node.text:
Here’s the recipe: 
 
Ingredients: 
Approx. 1.5 pounds Brussels sprouts (or other veggies of choice!) 
1/4 cup apple cider vinegar 
1/4 cup whiskey 
1/4 cup unsalted vegan butter (@floraplantus)
1/4 cup maple syrup 
1/2 handful fresh thyme
1/2 tsp sea salt 
1 pinch pepper 
1 cup water 
 
Directions:
 
In a large pan/pot, sauté the veggies in the plant butter for a few minutes. 
Add all other ingredients and bring to a boil. 
Lower heat and let simmer for 10-15 minutes. Enjoy! 

#MadeWithFlora @floraplantus (it’s vegan, but tastes, looks & works just like dairy butter!). Find out where you can buy Flora on Flora.com

Videography by @adamkenworthy & @sameatsplants_ for @bestofvegan 💚🌿

#VeganButter #BestOfVegan #Vegan #Butter #Brusselssprouts #Plantbased #BestOfVeganVideos #BestOfVeganFood #VeganRecipes #RecipeVideo #IGTV

node.title: Vegan Butter & Whiskey Brussels Sprouts made w/ @FloraPlantUS butter (AD)🌿

node.text:
Vegan Fried Sage & Browned Butter Cacio e Pepe featuring @FloraPlantUS’ plant butter:
 
(CC: watch in full screen to view closed captions)

Ingredients:
 
Serves 2
 
7.5 Spaghetti (dry weight)
3 tbsp unsalted vegan butter
1/2 tsp freshly ground pepper
3 minced garlic cloves 
1/4-1/3 cup reserved pasta water 
1/2 cup grated vegan parmesan cheese 
Sea salt to taste
1 handful fresh sage 
More vegan butter (salted) for frying 
 
 
Instructions:
 
Cook the pasta according to package instructions (reserve some of the pasta water)
Drain the pasta, then add it to a pan with the 3tbsp vegan butter. Cook over medium heat. 
Add the pepper, sea salt and grated vegan Parmesan cheese, then add a bit of pasta water, mix and cook until the butter and cheese are melted. Add a little more water if need be. 
In a separate small pan, heat the salted butter until it starts browning. Add the sage and fry until just crispy but not burnt. 
Serve with the pasta and a little more fresh pepper. 

Video by @AdamKenworthy for @BestOfVegan using @FloraPlantUS plant butter. 

Go to https://www.flora.com/en-us/floraplant/find-us to find out where you can buy Flora Plant Butter.

node.text:
(Closed captions provided in full-screen mode) 

Recipe: 
5-6 large yellow onions, thinly sliced
4 garlic cloves, minced 
1/4 cup unsalted vegan butter (@floraplantus)
1 handful fresh thyme 
1 bay leaf
1/4 cup vegan mozzarella 
1/2-3/4 cup white wine 
2-3 tablespoons all-purpose flour 
4 cups vegetable broth 
Sea salt and pepper to taste
 
To serve: 
Grilled sliced sourdough bread or baguette
salted vegan butter (@floraplantus)
 
Instructions: 
 
Add the vegan butter to a pot with the thinly sliced onions and caramelize them over medium heat for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to low-medium and caramelize for another 10-15 minutes (stir to prevent burning).
Each time it starts browning, deglaze with a little white wine (1/2-3/4 cup total). 
Once the onions are fully caramelized, add the garlic and all-purpose flour and mix again. 
Add the thyme, bay leaf and broth, cover and let simmer over low to medium heat for 10-12 minutes.
Remove the thyme and bay leaf and then add salt and pepper to taste. 
Add the butter to the bread, top with vegan mozzarella and broil. Serve with the soup.

(CC: Watch in full screen mode to see the closed captions)

Video by @adamkenworthy & @sameatsplants_ for @bestofvegan, featuring @floraplantus (go to Flora.com to find out where you can buy Flora plant Butter).

node.text:
Ingredients: 

(Makes 12-15 cookies)

INGREDIENTS 
1/2 cup unsalted @FloraPlantUS plant butter (112g)
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup cane sugar 
1 + 1/4 cup all purpose flour* 153g (note: spoon the flour into the measuring cup or use a scale) 
1/4 cup cacao powder
1 tsp baking Soda
1 pinch of sea salt
2 Tbsp unsweetened cashew milk (or any other non-dairy milk)
3.5 oz dark chocolate (roughly chopped)
1/2 tsp sea salt flakes 

INSTRUCTIONS

1) Preheat the oven to 350°F
2) Cream the plant butter and sugar in a bowl using a (preferably electric) mixer. 
3) Sift the all-purpose flour, then add the cacao powder, baking soda and sea salt. 
4) Mix using a spatula or your hands, add the cashew milk and mix again.
5) Roughly chop the chocolate and mix 1/2 of it into the dough. 
6) Form 12-15 small dough balls and place them on a thin baking tray/cookie sheet lined with parchment paper (you may need 2 trays if you don’t have a large one). Make sure you leave enough space between the cookies as they’ll spread while baking.
7) Bake for 10 minutes slightly above the middle of the oven (if you made bigger cookies or if you’re using a glass or other thicker tray, you may need to increase the baking time by 1-2 minutes, but be sure to still check at the 10-minute mark).
8) Add the remaining chopped chocolate to each of the cookies and sprinkle the sea salt flakes on top. 
9) Let the cookies cool for at least 10-20 minutes, then enjoy with a glass of ice cold plant milk! 

Video by @AdamKenworthy & @SamEatsPlants_ in collaboration with @FloraPlantUS. Recipe by @VeganReset. 

Go to https://www.flora.com/en-us/floraplant/find-us to find out where you can get Flora.

node.text:
Recipe by @courtneygrant1:

Food Processor: 2 cups of walnuts, 2 cups of Hazelnuts. blend until its blended nicely, still have a little bit of chunks. Add 1 cup of dats and blend again until dats are in pieces. Add mix to a bowl.

Bowl: Add in half a cup of vegan chocolate chips, 5 to 10 tablespoons of ground flax seed, 1 scoop of protein powder and mix well. Add in 1 cup of oatmeal mix in and add agave. Add agave until your mixture is sticky and clumps together (half a cup). 

Power Balls: Grab a cluster of mix and press it into the palm of your hand. Pack it into a ball and form your ball as you press it to condense it. 

Fridge: Place in fridge for 30 to 45 minutes and... 

ENJOY!

Recipe by @courtneygrant1.

node.text:
Served with vegan ranch dressing! Get both recipes below ⬇️

A huge thank you to @AlexaJenal for taking over Best of Vegan today and to @FlamingoInterpreting for providing the voiceover for this video 🧡

Vegan Ranch dressing by @AlexaJenal:

1 cup vegan Mayo 
2 tbsp plant milk
2 tsp Apple cider vinegar
1 tsp onion powder
1/4 tsp salt n pepper
1 tbsp dill, chives and parsley

Buffalo Cauliflower Wings:
Ingredients
Ingredients:

1 cauliflower head, cut into florets
Batter ingredients:

Dry: 
1 cup all-purpose flour 
1 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp paprika 
1 tsp onion powder 
½ tsp ground pepper
½ tsp sea salt 

Wet:
¾ cup unsweetened plant milk
⅓ cup water 

Buffalo sauce ingredients:

2 tbsp soy sauce
2 tbsp hot sauce 
2 tbsp maple syrup
2 tbsp cornstarch
¼ cup water 
1 tbsp apple cider vinegar 
2 tbsp vegan butter

Instructions

Preheat the oven to 400°F/200°C. 
Prepare the batter by mixing the dry ingredients in a bowl and slowly pouring and mixing in the wet ingredients using a whisk or a fork until you get a smooth, lump-free consistency. 
Line a large baking tray with parchment paper and start dipping the cauliflower florets in the batter until they’re fully coated. Shake the florets lightly to remove any excess batter and then place them on the baking tray one by one. 
Bake for 25 minutes (optional: flip half way through). 
While the florets are baking, start making the sauce by melting the vegan butter in a small pot. Once it’s melted add all other ingredients. Mix and cook it until it starts to thicken. 
Take the florets out of the oven and lower the heat to 350F. Dip each floret into the sauce, remove any excess and then place it back on the baking tray.
Bake for 25 more minutes and then let the cauliflower wings cool for a few minutes (but not too long, they’re best eaten warm to hot). 
Serve with vegan ranch dressing and enjoy!

@AlexaJenal
@FlamingoInterpreting 

#SuperBowl
#GameDay
#BestofVegan
#ASL

Watch our editor Sam make a delicious, quick & easy umami veggie fried rice using just a few simple ingredients and @Yondu.USA’s umami vegetable seasoning sauce 💚 Yondu is a vegan all-purpose savory seasoning sauce that you can use in plant-based dishes instead of fish sauce and even soy sauce, miso and vegetable broth. Go to https://yondu.us to find out where you can buy @Yondu.USA 💚

For closed captions, view this video on our IGTV channel :)

node.text:
Full recipe below ⬇️ Check out Lloyd’s new eBook at plantcrazii.com or via the link in his bio @plantcrazii 🧡

Recipe: 

You will need: 
1 large cauliflower 
2 tbsp hot sauce 
1/2 tsp black pepper 
1 tsp all purpose seasoning salt Oil for deep frying(vegetable oil, avocado oil, sunflower oil) 

Wet mix Bowl:
1 1/2 cup dairy free milk 
2 tbsp white vinegar 

Dry Mix Bowl:
1 cup all purpose flour
1/2 cup corn starch 
3 tsp all purpose seasoning salt 
3 tsp black pepper 
1/2 tsp cayenne pepper 
1 tsp onion powder 
1 tsp garlic powder 
1/2 tbsp paprika 
1/2 tbsp dry crushed rosemary 

Method: 
Rinse cauliflower and seperate into florets 
Coat florets with 2tbsp hot sauce, 1/2 tsp black pepper and 1 tsp seasoning salt 
Mix the ingredients of the wet bowl mix together 
Mix the ingredients of the dry bowl mix together 
Dip florets into the dry mix then the wet mix and again into the dry mix. 
Deep fry florets in hot oil for 10 minutes or until golden and crunchy.

Recipe & video by @plantcrazii 

Get the ebook on plantcrazii.com (direct link in @plantcrazii’s bio).

#bestofveganvideos 
#bestofvegan 

Bestofvegan.com/LloydRose

node.text:
Quick & Easy veggie coconut curry over brown rice and quinoa! To make this, we used one of @simplyorganicfoods’ brand-new vegan simmer sauces and it was delicious. 🌿

Watch the video for all ingredients and step by step instructions (subtitles provided!). 

Check out all of @simplyorganicfoods’ new sauces (and find out where you can buy them) here: 

https://www.simplyorganic.com/sauces/

BOV Senior editor: @sameatsplants_ 

#BestOfVegan
#SimplyOrganic

node.title: Coconut Curry made with @simplyorganicfoods’ new Simmer Sauce (AD) ❤️

node.text:
Ingredients:

•2 cups cubed watermelon
•2 whole limes – squeezed of all juice
•2 whole stalks scallion – sliced
•1 jalapeño – minced
•handful of fresh coriander – roughly chopped plus whole leaves for garnish
•1/2 English cucumber – diced same size as watermelon
•zest from 1 lime
•2-3 tbsp good extra virgin olive oil
•kosher salt
•freshly ground black pepper
•4 flour tortillas
•cooking spray

1. Place watermelon in a large bowl. Add in fresh lime juice, mix, and let sit for at least 15-20 minutes. This allows the lime juice to absorb into the watermelon, break it down a bit, and balance out the sweetness.
2. Make the tortillas. In a nonstick skillet, spray with cooking spray and place over medium high flame. Once hot, add in the tortilla. It’ll start forming bubbles, so just use your knife to carefully poke a few holes so it flattens. Toast on each side for about 1-2 minutes until golden brown. Remove and cut into chips. Set aside to cool.
3. In a separate large shallow bowl, mix together scallions, jalapeños, coriander, cucumber, lime zest, black pepper, a large pinch of kosher salt and olive oil.
4. Add watermelon to the cucumber mixture, straining from the remaining lime juice mixture. Combine well, taste to make sure there is enough salt. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve with homemade chippers!

[Recipe & Videography by @ChefPriyanka, as posted on https://www.chefpriyanka.com/watermelon-ceviche/]

#BestofVegan 
#BestofVeganVideos
#NationalWaterMelonDay 

Follow @ChefPriyanka for even more delicious recipes!

node.title: Watermelon Ceviche by @ChefPriyanka for National Watermelon Day 🍉

node.text:
We couldn’t be more excited to celebrate Best of Vegan contributor @hailethomas’ very first cookbook launching TODAY! 

It’s so much more than a cookbook! It’s an empowerment lifestyle book and we know you’ll absolutely love it. Watch this video to learn more (subtitles provided).

Click on the link below to order your copy now (this is the swipe up link mentioned at the end of the video): 

https://www.harpercollins.com/products/living-lively-haile-thomas

(note: links become clickable once you watch videos on IGTV) 

@hailethomas 
#LivingLively 
#BestofVegan

node.text:
How to make @plantcrazii’s Brussels Sprouts 💚

1 lb Brussels sprouts
2 tbsp light olive oil
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 tsp black pepper
1/2 tsp garlic powder

Garnish:
2 tbsp pure maple syrup
2 tbsp balsamic vinegar 
1 tbsp lime juice

1️⃣Rinse Brussel sprouts really well and cut off the brown edges at the bottom then cut your sprouts in half (lengthwise)
2️⃣Place them in a large bowl and mix in the olive oil, salt, black pepper and garlic powder
3️⃣Spread them out on a lined baking tray and bake for 30 minutes at 400 degrees Fahrenheit
4️⃣Remove them from the oven and place them back into the large bowl then mix in the maple syrup, balsamic vinegar and lime juice
*add additional salt to taste if needed
Enjoy as a snack or a side dish

#igreels #cooking #cookingvideos #plantbased #vegan #veganrecipes #vegetarianrecipes #yummy #food #bestofvegan #BestOfVeganFood #BestOfVeganVideos #RecipeVideos

Follow @plantcrazii for even more delicious recipes!

node.text:
EASY VEGAN MAC’N CHEESE made with @ForagerProject’s new delicious vegan cheeses 🧡 (AD) 

(Serves 2)
6 oz elbow pasta 
2 tbsp vegan butter
2 tbsp all purpose flour 
1 1/2 cups plant milk, unsweetened 
2-3 cups of @ForagerProject’s vegan cheese 
1 tsp garlic powder 
1 pinch sea salt 
1 pinch pepper 
1/2 tsp smoked paprika 

To top:
1/4 cup panko bread crumbs, toasted (optional) 

Directions:

1.Cook the pasta according to package instructions.
2.Melt the vegan butter in a pot and add the flour while whisking, then add a little plant milk so it becomes a sauce. 
3.Add the cooked pasta and vegan cheese. 
4.Cook over medium heat and stir while adding the remaining plant milk. Cook until the cheese is fully melted (add more milk and butter if need be.) Enjoy!

Videography by Marissa Wong for Best of Vegan. Recipe by Best of Vegan. 

Go to foragerproject.com & follow @foragerproject to find out where you can buy their new cheeses (they stretch & melt!) and to get many more vegan recipe ideas. 

#ForagerProject #BestOfVegan #BestOfVeganFood #Macncheese #VeganMacncheese #Plantbased #Vegan #BestOfVeganPasta #BestOfVeganVideos #WhatVegansEat #VeganRecipes

node.text:
Meet @PlantBased.Passport 💚🌿 Today, Best of Vegan contributors Val & Mani from @PlantBased.Passport are debuting their new interview series “BIPOC PORTRAITS” on bestofvegan.com (Link in bio).

[The acronym BIPOC stands for Black, Indigenous, and People of Color.] 

BIPOC Portraits is a series in which Best of Vegan contributors Val & Mani Latifi profile one BIPOC vegan creator each week over the course of 16 weeks, to shed light on the unique challenges BIPOCs face in making the decision to embrace veganism. For BIPOCs, the prevailing narrative that veganism is a white-dominated movement can often mean a perceived loss of cultural identity. The hope of this profile series is to make veganism a little less lonely for BIPOCs and to give courage to vegan-curious BIPOCs out there. In the first installment of BIPOC Portraits, Val & Mani share their journey to veganism.

Follow the link in our bio (@bestofvegan) to read the article and get two delicious vegan recipes by @plantbased.passport. 

#BestOfVegan
#BIPOCPortraits 
#BestOfVeganInterviews

node.text:
Funfetti Cinny Roll in a Mug by @FloraPlantUS 💗 (AD)

Ingredients
 
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon 
1 tablespoon light brown sugar 
1 tablespoon Flora™ Plant Butter Unsalted 
2 tablespoons non-dairy milk 
1/4 cup all-purpose flour 
1/4 teaspoon baking powder 
1 pinch kosher salt

Instructions
 
In a small bowl mix cinnamon and light brown sugar together. Set aside, 
Place butter in a microwavable mug or ramekin and microwave for about 20 seconds to melt. 
Add non-dairy milk, flour, baking powder, salt, and half of the cinnamon brown sugar mixture to melted butter. Whisk until batter forms. Sprinkle the remaining cinnamon brown sugar on top of batter. Microwave for 1 minute 25 seconds.

[Recipe & Photography by @FloraPlantUS]

#BestOfVegan #BestOfVeganFood 

Follow @FloraPlantUS for even more delicious recipes!

node.text:
No-Bake Triple Chocolate Square by @365cleaneats ❤️
(Vegan l Gluten & Nut-Free)

Recipe for 18cm x 18cm Square Tin⁣⁣
Base:
(Dry)
2/3 cup (60g) GF rolled oats*
2/3 cup(60g) coconut fine*
1/4 cup (50g) sunflower seeds*
1 Tbsp. raw cacao powder
1 Tbsp. raw cacao nib (optional)
(Wet)
2 Tbsp. maple syrup
3 Tbsp. melted coconut oil
*You can use your choice of nuts & seeds

Chocolate Filling:⁣⁣
3/4 cup (180ml) coconut cream or full fat coconut milk⁣
1/2 cup (50 g) coconut ⁣fine
1/4 cup (4Tbsp.) coconut oil⁣
7-8 Tbsp. raw cacao powder⁣
6 Tbsp. maple syrup
1/4 tsp pink salt 
**Bitterness of raw cacao powder may vary. Please adjust the amount of the powder according to preference.⁣

Chocolate ganache:⁣⁣
120g dark chocolate (I used 70%)
1/2 cup (120ml) coconut cream or full fat coconut milk(or plant milk)⁣⁣

⁣*1 Tbsp.=15ml

Directions: ⁣⁣

1. Line a tin with parchment paper.⠀
2. In a food processor place every dry ingredient for the base and process until well processed. Add wet ingredients and process until it becomes like wet sand. 
3. Press the crust into the bottom of the tin. 
4. In a high speed blender place every ingredient for the chocolate layer and blend well until smooth. Add more sweetener if you wish. Layer the filling above the base. Cool it in the freezer until set. ⁣⁣⁣
5. To make the chocolate ganache, place chopped chocolate in a small bowl. Heat coconut cream until just before boil. Pour over the chocolate and stir together until well combined.⁣
6. Pour the ganache over the chocolate layer and flatten the surface with a spatula.⁣
7. Put it in the freezer until set. Take out from the tin and cut with a warm knife.⁣

[Recipe & Photography by @365cleaneats] 

#BestOfVegan #BestOfVeganFood

Follow @365cleaneats for even more delicious recipes!

node.text:
Quick Pantry Chickpea Curry by @cookingforpeanuts 🧡

Recipe: 

Roast 1 medium sweet potato at 425F until fork tender. Or use leftover cooked sweet potato. 

Add to medium saucepan: 1/2 cup unsweetened plant milk (soy, almond, or use coconut milk for thicker curry), 2 tbsp Thai red curry paste, 1 cup vegetable broth, 2 tbsp peanut butter. Whisk well to incorporate all ingredients while heating. Bring to a boil before reducing heat to a simmer. 

Add 1 tbsp tamari, and 1/2 cup mashed baked sweet potato. Whisk to incorporate sweet potato while simmering. Once sweet potato is mostly incorporated, simmer covered about 5 minutes. 

Transfer to a blender and blend on high until smooth. Return to stove and add juice of 1 small lime, and 1-15oz can chickpeas. Heat on low until warmed through. Season with salt and fresh lime juice to taste.

[Recipe & Photography by @cookingforpeanuts] 

#BestOfVegan
#BestOfVeganFood 

Follow @cookingforpeanuts for even more delicious recipes!

❤️ LIKE & SAVE this post 
❤️ FOLLOW @ForagerProject, @VeganReset & @BryantTerry 
❤️ COMMENT below (either tag a friend, share your favorite emoji, tell us why you’d like to win, or all of the above, you choose;) Multiple entries allowed, each separate comment counts as an entry)

That’s it! The winner will be announced here on Sunday 9/5 at 2pm EST. Good luck! 🍀 This giveaway is open to participants worldwide and is in no way affiliated with or endorsed by Instagram. Should any of the items not be available where you live, we’ll work with you to find the best possible alternative(s). (Note: the Forager Project products depicted may vary depending on availability.)

⚠️ IMPORTANT: we won’t be announcing the winner before 9/5 at 2pm EST (they’ll be announced in the caption of this post) and we will never contact you from a different account. If you receive a message from anyone other than @bestofvegan (check the username’s spelling) about this giveaway please notify us and block and report them.

node.text:
How to make @Woon.Heng’s Sweet & Sour Vegan ‘Fish’ 🧡

INGREDIENTS

10 oz [270g] King trumpet mushrooms
16 oz [454g] firm tofu pressed or moisture removed
6 nori sheets
6 large rice paper [22cm-25cm]
½ teaspoon sugar
½ teaspoon mushrooms seasoning
1 teaspoon salt
dash of white pepper
1 tablespoon cornstarch plus more for dusting
Sauce
1 cup water
2 tablespoons ketchup
1 tablespoon rice vinegar
2 tablespoon sugar
1 teaspoon lemon juice
1 tablespoon soy sauce
½ teaspoon salt
1 small tomato cut into cubes
¼ cup chopped cucumber skin removed
Cornstarch slurry
1 teaspoon cornstarch + 1 teaspoon water mix to combine

INSTRUCTIONS

Using your hands, tear the mushrooms into large pieces. (Alternatively, you can do this with a knife.) 
Heat a nonstick skillet with 2 teaspoons of oil over medium-low heat. Sauté the mushrooms until they start to form a brown crust, 3 to 5 minutes. Season with a pinch of salt and transfer to a food processor.

(Continued in the comments below ⬇️) 

[Recipe & Videography by @woon.heng, as posted on WoonHeng.com] 

#BestOfVegan #BestOfVeganVideos #BestOfVeganFood #Vegan #Plantbased #ThisIsNotFish #Seaspiracy 

Follow @woon.heng for even more delicious recipes!
